medical_history.chief_complaint: Concerns about developmental regression in communication.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at around 12 months when the patient stopped vocalizing. Parents linked this loss of words to a series of four ear infections over 2–3 months, after which the child became increasingly less socially engaged, developing an aversion to bright lights and loud noises by 15 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient's brother was diagnosed with autism at 2 years old. Helen’s mother had thyroid disease during pregnancy. Helen was treated for low blood sugar after birth and exhibited colic and feeding difficulties.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes the patient's brother diagnosed with autism; otherwise, there is no known family history of autism or other developmental disorders.
